# decelerationRate

**Instance Property**

A floating-point value that determines the rate of deceleration after the user lifts their finger.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var decelerationRate: UIScrollView.DecelerationRate { get set }
```

## Discussion

The default rate is [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIScrollView/DecelerationRate-swift.struct/normal]. For possible deceleration rates, see [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIScrollView/DecelerationRate-swift.struct].

## Managing the scrolling state

- **isTracking**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the user has touched the content to initiate scrolling.
- **isDragging**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the user has begun scrolling the content.
- **isDecelerating**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the content is moving in the scroll view after the user lifted their finger.
- **isScrollAnimating**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the scroll view is currently animating a scroll update.
- **stopScrollingAndZooming()**: Stops active scroll and zoom animations.
- **UIScrollView.DecelerationRate**: Deceleration rates for the scroll view.
